segment.source: Reset the PC to repair the device or transfer it to another owner.
segment.target: Reset the PC to repair the device or transfer it to another owner.

segment.source: Resetting a desktop PC
segment.target: Resetting a desktop PC

segment.source: Resetting a desktop device
segment.target: Resetting a desktop device

segment.source: Resetting the device addresses a number of key scenarios:
segment.target: Resetting the device addresses a number of key scenarios:

segment.source: A user may want to reset a device to transfer it to another owner.
segment.target: A user may want to reset a device to transfer it to another owner.

segment.source: The device belongs to an organization, and the organization wants to reset the device.
segment.target: The device belongs to an organization, and the organization wants to reset the device.

segment.source: For example, when an employee leaves the organization.
segment.target: For example, when an employee leaves the organization.

segment.source: The device has malfunctioned and the user wants to reset the device.
segment.target: The device has malfunctioned and the user wants to reset the device.

segment.source: An OEM has completed factory testing and wants to reset the device (optionally preserving preloaded map data).
segment.target: An OEM has completed factory testing and wants to reset the device (optionally preserving preloaded map data).

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: When you reset a device, it does not return it to the original factory state.
segment.target: When you reset a device, it does not return it to the original factory state.

segment.source: For example, any packages that were added or modified during an update remain.
segment.target: For example, any packages that were added or modified during an update remain.

segment.source: To return the device to the original factory state, you must flash it with the original factory image.
segment.target: To return the device to the original factory state, you must flash it with the original factory image.

segment.source: Ways to reset a desktop PC
segment.target: Ways to reset a desktop PC

segment.source: If Settings is accessible:
segment.target: If Settings is accessible:

segment.source: Click SettingsUpdate & securityRecovery under Reset this PC, click Get started.
segment.target: Click SettingsUpdate & securityRecovery under Reset this PC, click Get started.

segment.source: Select either Keep my files to repair the PC, or Remove everything to prepare the PC for a new user.
segment.target: Select either Keep my files to repair the PC, or Remove everything to prepare the PC for a new user.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: If the device is not responsive, try restarting it first.
segment.target: If the device is not responsive, try restarting it first.

segment.source: If Settings is not accessible:
segment.target: If Settings is not accessible:

segment.source: Click the power button, then hold down Shift while choosing Restart.
segment.target: Click the power button, then hold down Shift while choosing Restart.

segment.source: This opens the recovery menu.
segment.target: This opens the recovery menu.

segment.source: This works even if you're not logged into Windows.
segment.target: This works even if you're not logged into Windows.

segment.source: Click Troubleshoot.
segment.target: Click Troubleshoot.

segment.source: Select either Refresh your PC to repair the PC, or Reset your PC to prepare the PC for another user.
segment.target: Select either Refresh your PC to repair the PC, or Reset your PC to prepare the PC for another user.

segment.source: For PCs, there isn't a built-in way to reset a device remotely.
segment.target: For PCs, there isn't a built-in way to reset a device remotely.

segment.source: However, you can install third-party tools that allow you to do this.
segment.target: However, you can install third-party tools that allow you to do this.
